TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit DateUtils extends Java.Lang.Object

Docs.summary: This class contains various date-related utilities for creating text for things like elapsed time and date ranges, strings for days of the week and months, and AM/PM text etc.

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

a bit mask of options See #formatDateRange(Context, Formatter, long, long, int, String) formatDateRange

Docs.param: the context is required only if the time is shown
the Formatter used for formatting the date range. Note: be sure to call setLength(0) on StringBuilder passed to the Formatter constructor unless you want the results to accumulate.
the start time in UTC milliseconds
the end time in UTC milliseconds
a bit mask of options See #formatDateRange(Context, Formatter, long, long, int, String) formatDateRange
the time zone to compute the string in. Use null for local or if the FORMAT_UTC flag is being used.
Docs.summary: Formats a date or a time range according to the local conventions.
Docs.returns: a string containing the formatted date/time range.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig string GetAMPMString(int32 ampm) cil managed

Docs.param: Either Calendar#AM Calendar.AM or Calendar#PM Calendar.PM.
Docs.summary: Return a localized string for AM or PM.
Docs.returns: Localized version of "AM" or "PM".

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.exception: if the ampm is out of bounds.

MemberSignature.Value: public static string GetDayOfWeekString (int dayOfWeek, Android.Text.Format.AbbreviationLength abbrev);
.method public static hidebysig string GetDayOfWeekString(int32 dayOfWeek, valuetype Android.Text.Format.AbbreviationLength abbrev) cil managed
static member GetDayOfWeekString : int * Android.Text.Format.AbbreviationLength -> string

Docs.param: One of Calendar#SUNDAY Calendar.SUNDAY, Calendar#MONDAY Calendar.MONDAY, etc.

One of #LENGTH_LONG, #LENGTH_SHORT, #LENGTH_MEDIUM, or #LENGTH_SHORTEST. Note that in most languages, #LENGTH_SHORT will return the same as #LENGTH_MEDIUM. Undefined lengths will return #LENGTH_MEDIUM but may return something different in the future.
Docs.summary: Return a string for the day of the week.
Docs.returns: To be added.

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.exception: if the dayOfWeek is out of bounds.

Docs.param: One of Calendar#JANUARY Calendar.JANUARY, Calendar#FEBRUARY Calendar.FEBRUARY, etc.
One of #LENGTH_LONG, #LENGTH_MEDIUM, or #LENGTH_SHORTEST. Undefined lengths will return #LENGTH_MEDIUM but may return something different in the future.
Docs.summary: Return a localized string for the month of the year.
Docs.returns: Localized month of the year.

MemberSignature.Value: public static string GetRelativeDateTimeString (Android.Content.Context c, long time, long minResolution, long transitionResolution, Android.Text.Format.FormatStyleFlags flags);

.method public static hidebysig string GetRelativeDateTimeString(class Android.Content.Context c, int64 time, int64 minResolution, int64 transitionResolution, valuetype Android.Text.Format.FormatStyleFlags flags) cil managed
static member GetRelativeDateTimeString : Android.Content.Context * int64 * int64 * int64 * Android.Text.Format.FormatStyleFlags -> string

Docs.param: To be added.
some time in the past.
the minimum elapsed time (in milliseconds) to report when showing relative times. For example, a time 3 seconds in the past will be reported as "0 minutes ago" if this is set to #MINUTE_IN_MILLIS.

the elapsed time (in milliseconds) at which to stop reporting relative measurements. Elapsed times greater than this resolution will default to normal date formatting. For example, will transition from "7 days ago" to "Dec 12" when using #WEEK_IN_MILLIS.
To be added.
Docs.summary: Return string describing the elapsed time since startTime formatted like "[relative time/date], [time]".
Docs.returns: To be added.

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

some time in the past.
the minimum elapsed time (in milliseconds) to report when showing relative times. For example, a time 3 seconds in the past will be reported as "0 minutes ago" if this is set to #MINUTE_IN_MILLIS.

the elapsed time (in milliseconds) at which to stop reporting relative measurements. Elapsed times greater than this resolution will default to normal date formatting. For example, will transition from "7 days ago" to "Dec 12" when using #WEEK_IN_MILLIS.
To be added.
Docs.summary: Return string describing the elapsed time since startTime formatted like "[relative time/date], [time]".
Docs.returns: To be added.

If true, the string returned will include the correct preposition ("at 9:20am", "on 10/12/2008" or "on May 29").

MemberSignature.Value: public static Java.Lang.ICharSequence GetRelativeTimeSpanStringFormatted (long time, long now, long minResolution);
.method public static hidebysig class Java.Lang.ICharSequence GetRelativeTimeSpanStringFormatted(int64 time, int64 now, int64 minResolution) cil managed
static member GetRelativeTimeSpanStringFormatted : int64 * int64 * int64 -> Java.Lang.ICharSequence

Docs.param: the time to describe, in milliseconds
the current time in milliseconds

the minimum timespan to report. For example, a time 3 seconds in the past will be reported as "0 minutes ago" if this is set to MINUTE_IN_MILLIS. Pass one of 0, MINUTE_IN_MILLIS, HOUR_IN_MILLIS, DAY_IN_MILLIS, WEEK_IN_MILLIS
Docs.summary: Returns a string describing the elapsed time since startTime.
Docs.returns: a String object containing the elapsed time.

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: public static Java.Lang.ICharSequence GetRelativeTimeSpanStringFormatted (long time, long now, long minResolution, Android.Text.Format.FormatStyleFlags flags);

.method public static hidebysig class Java.Lang.ICharSequence GetRelativeTimeSpanStringFormatted(int64 time, int64 now, int64 minResolution, valuetype Android.Text.Format.FormatStyleFlags flags) cil managed
static member GetRelativeTimeSpanStringFormatted : int64 * int64 * int64 * Android.Text.Format.FormatStyleFlags -> Java.Lang.ICharSequence

Docs.param: the time to describe, in milliseconds
the current time in milliseconds

the minimum timespan to report. For example, a time 3 seconds in the past will be reported as "0 minutes ago" if this is set to MINUTE_IN_MILLIS. Pass one of 0, MINUTE_IN_MILLIS, HOUR_IN_MILLIS, DAY_IN_MILLIS, WEEK_IN_MILLIS
a bit mask of formatting options, such as Android.Text.Format.DateUtils.FORMAT_NUMERIC_DATE or Android.Text.Format.DateUtils.FORMAT_ABBREV_RELATIVE
Docs.summary: Returns a string describing the elapsed time since startTime.
Docs.returns: a String object containing the elapsed time.
